meanings.definition: To move or drive a flock of sheep or other livestock.
meanings.sent1: The farmer hirseling the sheep towards the barn.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys hirseling the cows to the pasture every morning.
meanings.sent3: The hirseling of the ducks into the pond turned into a playful race.
meanings.sent4: The wind hirseling the leaves across the yard was a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent5: The children watched in awe as the shepherd hirseling the sheep through the meadow.

meanings.definition: A person who herds or tends livestock.
meanings.sent1: The hirseling guided the sheep safely through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The hirseling was known for his gentle way with the animals.
meanings.sent3: The little hirseling entertained the farm animals with funny dances.
meanings.sent4: She was a hirseling, leading her team through the challenges with care.
meanings.sent5: The old hirseling shared stories of the animals' adventures with the village children.
